Welcome to Rest API project’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.birthdays_per_week(days: int, skip: int, limit: int, db: Session)¶
The birthdays_per_week function returns a list of users whose birthdays are within the next

‘days’ days. The function takes three arguments:

Parameters:

  • days – int: Determine how many days in the future to look for birthdays

  • skip – int: Skip the first n records

  • limit – int: Limit the number of users returned

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of users whose birthday is within the next n days

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

The confirmed_email function takes an email and a database session as arguments. It then gets the user by their email, sets their confirmed status to True, and commits the change.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Get the email of the user

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

Nothing

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session)¶

The create_user function creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Validate the request body against the usermodel schema

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.get_user(user_id: int, db: Session)¶

The get_user function is used to retrieve a user from the database. It takes in an integer representing the id of the user and a Session object representing an open connection to our database. It returns either None or a User object.

Parameters:

  • user_id – int: Specify the user_id of the user we want to retrieve

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → Users | None¶

The get_user_by_email function is used to retrieve a user from the database by their email address. It returns None if no user with that email exists.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the email of the user we want to get

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The first user with the given email address

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.get_users(db: Session)¶

The get_users function returns a list of all users in the database.

Parameters:

db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of all the users in the database

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.remove_user(user_id: int, db: Session)¶

The remove_user function removes a user from the database.

Parameters:

  • user_id – int: Specify the user to be deleted

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The user object that was deleted from the database

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.search_user(q: str, skip: int, limit: int, db: Session)¶

The search_user function searches for users in the database.

Parameters:

  • q – str: Search for a user by first name, last name or email

  • skip – int: Skip the first n results

  • limit – int: Limit the number of results returned

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of users

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email, url: str, db: Session) → Users¶

The update_avatar function takes an email and a url as arguments. It then uses the get_user_by_email function to find the user with that email, and sets their avatar property to be equal to the url argument. It then commits the changes made in db and returns the updated user.

Parameters:

  • email – Find the user in the database

  • url – str: Specify the type of data that is expected to be passed in

  • db – Session: Pass a database session to the function

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: Users, refresh_token, db: Session)¶

The update_token function updates the refresh token for a user.

Parameters:

  • user – Users: Pass in the user object

  • refresh_token – Update the user’s refresh token in the database

  • db – Session: Commit the changes to the database

Returns:

The user’s refresh token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_user(body: UserModel, user_id: int, db: Session)¶
The update_user function updates the user’s information in the database.
Args:

body (UserModel): The UserModel object containing all of the user’s information. user_id (int): The id of the current logged in user.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Get the data from the request body

  • user_id – int: Get the user with that id from the database

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_user_email(body: UserEmailModel, user_id: int, db: Session)¶

The update_user_email function updates the email of a user.

Parameters:

  • body – UserEmailModel: Pass the data from the request body into the function

  • user_id – int: Identify the user that is being updated

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Users¶

async src.routes.users.birthday_users(days: int = Query(7), skip: int = 0, limit: int = Query(10), db: Session = Depends(get_db), curent_user: Users = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The birthday_users function returns a list of users who have birthdays in the next 7 days.

Parameters:

  • days – int: Get the number of days from the user

  • description – Provide a description for the endpoint

  • skip – int: Skip the first n users in the database

  • limit – int: Limit the number of results returned

  • le – Limit the number of records returned to 100

  • ge – Set the minimum value for the limit parameter

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • curent_user – Users: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A list of users that have a birthday in the next 7 days

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session = Depends(get_db), curent_user: Users = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The create_user function creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Get the data from the request body

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • curent_user – Users: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.users.get_user(user_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: Session = Depends(get_db), curent_user: Users = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_user function returns a user object with the given id. If the user does not exist, it raises an HTTP 404 error.

Parameters:

  • user_id – int: Specify the user_id that is passed in as a path parameter

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • curent_user – Users: Get the current user

Returns:

The user object if it exists, otherwise raises an httpexception

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.users.get_users(db: Session = Depends(get_db), curent_user: Users = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_users function returns a list of users.

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Pass the database connection to the function

  • curent_user – Users: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A list of users

current_user – Users: Pass the user object to the function

Returns:

The current_user object, which is the user who made the request

The remove_user function removes a user from the database.
Args:

user_id (int): The id of the user to remove. db (Session, optional): An open DB session. Defaults to Depends(get_db).

Parameters:

  • user_id – int: Get the user_id from the url

  • db – Session: Pass the database connection to the function

  • curent_user – Users: Get the current user

Returns:

The removed user

async src.routes.users.search_user(q: str = Query(PydanticUndefined), skip: int = 0, limit: int = Query(10), db: Session = Depends(get_db), curent_user: Users = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The search_user function allows you to search for users by name, last name or email.

The function returns a list of users that match the query.

Parameters:

  • q – str: Search by name, last name or email

  • email&quot;) (last name or) – Search by name, last name or email

  • skip – int: Skip the first n results

  • limit – int: Limit the number of results returned

  • le – Limit the number of results returned by the search_user function

  • ge – Set a minimum value for the limit parameter

  • ) – Define the number of results to return

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • curent_user – Users: Get the current user

Returns:

A list of users

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.users.update_avatar_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), current_user: Users = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The update_avatar_user function updates the avatar of a user.

The function takes in an UploadFile object, which is a file that has been uploaded to the server. It also takes in the current_user and db objects as dependencies.

Parameters:

  • file – UploadFile: Upload the file to cloudinary

  • current_user – Users: Get the current user that is logged in

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository layer

Returns:

The user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.users.update_user(body: UserModel, user_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: Session = Depends(get_db), curent_user: Users = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The update_user function updates a user in the database.

The function takes an id, and a body of type UserModel. It returns the updated user.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Get the data from the request body

  • user_id – int: Specify the path parameter

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • curent_user – Users: Get the current user

Returns:

The updated user

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.users.update_user_email(body: UserEmailModel, user_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: Session = Depends(get_db), curent_user: Users = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The update_user_email function updates the user’s email.
Args:

body (UserEmailModel): The new email to be updated. user_id (int): The id of the user whose email is being updated.

Parameters:

  • body – UserEmailModel: Pass the useremailmodel object to the update_user_email function

  • user_id – int: Get the user_id from the url

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • curent_user – Users: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A usermodel object

REST API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The confirmed_email function is used to confirm a user’s email address. The function takes the token from the URL and uses it to get the user’s email address. It then checks if there is a user with that email in our database, and if not, returns an error message. If there is a user with that email in our database, we check whether their account has already been confirmed or not. If it has been confirmed already, we return another message saying so; otherwise we update their account status to &quot;confirmed&quot;.

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the token from the url

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A dictionary with a message key

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The login function is used to authenticate a user.

Parameters:

  • body – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm: Get the username and password from the request body

  • db – Session: Get a database session

Returns:

A token, but it is not stored in the database

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The refresh_token function is used to refresh the access token. The function will check if the user has a valid refresh token and then return a new access_token and refresh_token.

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials: Get the token from the request header

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A new access token and a new refresh token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The request_email function is used to request a confirmation email.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Get the email from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the application

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A message to the user

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserModel, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The signup function creates a new user in the database. It takes a UserModel object as input, which contains the username and email of the new user. It also takes an optional BackgroundTasks object, which is used to send an email to the newly created user for confirmation purposes. Finally, it takes a Request object that is used to get information about the request made by the client (in this case we use it to get base_url). The function returns either a success message or raises an exception if there was any error.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Get the user’s email and password

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the server

  • db – Session: Get a database session

Returns:

A dictionary

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API service Auth¶

class src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = 'secret'¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

The create_access_token function creates a new access token.

Parameters:

  • self – Make the function a method of the class

  • data – dict: Pass the data that is to be encoded into the token

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the access token

Returns:

A jwt token

Doc-author:

Trelent

create_email_token(data: dict)¶

The create_email_token function creates a token that is used to verify the user’s email address. The token is created using the JWT library and contains information about when it was issued, when it expires, and what scope (or purpose) it has. The function returns this token.

Parameters:

  • self – Make the function a method of the class

  • data – dict: Pass in the data that will be encoded into the token

Returns:

A token that is encoded with the user’s email and a secret key

Doc-author:

Trelent

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_refresh_token function creates a refresh token for the user.

The function takes in three parameters: self, data, and expires_delta. The self parameter is used to access the SECRET_KEY and ALGORITHM variables from the OAuth2PasswordBearer class. The data parameter is a dictionary containing information about the user that will be encoded into JSON Web Token format (JWT). This includes their username, email address, password hash (hashed using bcrypt), and scope of authorization (&quot;refresh_token&quot;). It also contains two datetime objects: iat (issued at)

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass the data to be encoded into the jwt

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the token

Returns:

A refresh token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶
The decode_refresh_token function is used to decode the refresh token.

The function takes in a refresh_token as an argument and returns the email of the user if successful. If there is an error, it raises a HTTPException with status code 401 (Unauthorized) and detail message &quot;Invalid scope for token&quot; or &quot;Could not validate credentials&quot;.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • refresh_token – str: Pass in the refresh token that is being decoded

Returns:

A payload with the following information:

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be used in the

protected routes. It takes an OAuth2 token as input and returns the user associated with that token. If no user is found, it raises an exception.

Parameters:

  • self – Access the class attributes

  • token – str: Get the token from the authorization header

  • db – Session: Pass the database connection to the function

Returns:

The user object that corresponds to the email in the token

Doc-author:

Trelent

get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

The get_email_from_token function takes a token as an argument and returns the email address associated with that token. If the scope of the token is not &quot;email_token&quot;, then it raises an HTTPException. If there is a JWTError, then it also raises an HTTPException.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • token – str: Pass in the token that was sent to the user’s email

Returns:

The email address of the user who requested the token

Doc-author:

Trelent

get_password_hash(password: str)¶

The get_password_hash function takes a password and returns the hashed version of it. The hashing is done using the CryptContext object that was created in __init__.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • password – str: Get the password from the user

Returns:

A hash of the password

Doc-author:

Trelent

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
r = Redis<ConnectionPool<Connection<host=localhost,port=6379,db=0>>>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶

The verify_password function takes a plain-text password and hashed password as arguments. It then uses the verify method of the CryptContext object to check if the plain-text password matches the hashed one.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • plain_password – Verify the password that is entered by the user

  • hashed_password – Compare the plain_password parameter to see if they match

Returns:

A boolean value

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API service Mail¶

async src.services.mail.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶

The send_email function sends an email to the user with a link to confirm their email address. The function takes in three arguments: -email: The user’s email address, which is used as the recipient of the message. -username: The username of the user, which is used in constructing a personalized greeting for them. -host: The hostname that will be included in the confirmation link sent to them.

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Specify the email address of the recipient

  • username – str: Pass the username to the template

  • host – str: Pass the hostname of the server to the email template

Returns:

A coroutine, which is an object that can be used to get the return value of the

Doc-author:

Trelent
